column1: Ghân-buri-Ghân was the chief of the Drúedain who inhabited Drúadan Forest in the late Third Age.
He was the son of Ghân with whom he shared his name
column2: and became the chief of his tribe.

column1: During the War of the Ring
column2: Ghân-buri-Ghân helped King Théoden and the Rohirrim to avoid an army of Orcs by taking them through the secret pass of Stonewain Valley. This allowed the Rohirrim to arrive in time to fight the Battle of the Pelennor Fields. In return
column3: Théoden promised that the people of Rohan would no longer trouble the Drúedain and would drive away the Gorgûn (Orcs)

column1: Following the War of the Ring
column3: as High King of the Dúnedain of the Reunited Kingdom
column4: issued the decree that Drúadan Forest belonged to only Ghân and his people
column5: and that no one else was allowed to enter the forest without their permission.

column1: Ghân-buri-Ghân means "Ghân son of Ghân" (Ghân + buri).
